title.native: ガンダムビルドファイターズトライ アイランド・ウォーズ
title.romaji: GUNDAM BUILD FIGHTERS TRY: Island Wars

description:
One year after winning the Gunpla Battle National Championships, Team Try Fighters is invited by Yajima Trading to a remote island to test the company's new battle system. Sekai and Fumina arrive on the island, only to discover that Gyanko, Shia, and Minato were also invited. Yuuma declines the offer as he is assisting Mirai on a photoshoot, only to realize that he and his teammates are on the same island. Meanwhile, the Nielsen Lab experiences an anomaly with their new Plavsky particles forms a giant crystal and cause Gunpla on the island to go out of control. The Gunpla Fighters must band together to stop the crystal from wreaking havoc on all Gunpla Battle Systems around the world.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

title.native: ガンダムビルドファイターズトライ

name.native: キジマ・ウィルフリッド
ルーカス・カンカーンシュルヤ

node.description:
[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)
A Japanese band who has explored the genre's of Alternative Rock, Rap-Rock, and Synth Pop.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135414143)

Junya Ishigaki is a Japanese mechanical designer. His debut was as a guest mechanical designer on [Yuusha Exkaiser](https://anilist.co/anime/3325/Brave-Exkaiser/) in 1990 for Sunrise, where he worked for the next few years before going freelance. In 1998 he was one of the founders of the small short-lived Studio Trapezoid together with [Manabu Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/102190/Manabu-Ono), [Susumu Yamaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/109727/Susumu-Yamaguchi) and [Takuya Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/144019/Takuya-Saitou).

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenogears (Video Game, 1998) (Main Mechanical Design)
- Xenosaga: Episode I - Der Wille zur Macht (Video Game, 2002) (Mechanical Design, Production Designer)
- Xenosaga: Episode II - Jenseits von Gut und Böse (Video Game, 2004) (Mechanical Designer, Production Designer)
- Xenosaga: Episode III - Also Sprach Zarathustra (Video Game, 2006) (Production Designer)

__[Profile (Legendoor)](http://www.legendoor.com/artist/%E6%A9%98%E9%BA%BB%E7%BE%8E)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AsamiTachibana)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/achaamiii/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/caffemocha0428)__

A Japanese pianist, composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/151679259) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=1304769)

A freelance designer. He hasn't been active as an animator in over a decade.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyafic)

The representative director of Capsule, a CG animation company

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

Originating from [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Kunio Okawara was the first in the industry to be specifically credited as a mechanical designer. He is the designer of numerous Real Robots and Super Robots.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.
Shouji Ikeno is an episode director.
